interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

The change involves the addition of multiple words: "قال الرب" and "للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود," which collectively constitute more than one word being added to the text. This fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it includes significant additions that alter the content of the original reading.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

The change involves the addition of multiple words: "قال الرب" and "للذين اتو اليه من اليهود," which collectively constitute more than one word being added to the text. This aligns with the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, as it includes changes across more than one word.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change involves the omission of the final alif in the word اتوا, which is a spelling alteration that does not affect the meaning of the word. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a standardization of spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the text.
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

The major word "فكلمهم" is omitted entirely, which constitutes a significant change as it alters the meaning of the sentence. The omission of this key phrase affects the overall context and understanding of the text, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

The change involves the addition of the word صوته along with the retention of وقال, resulting in a modification across two words. This fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it includes more than one word being altered.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change involves the substitution of the preposition "الي" with "فى," which does not alter the root or grammatical function of the phrase but rather reflects a variation in spelling or orthography. The change from "الي" to "فى" can be seen as a standardization or correction of the preposition used, thus fitting the definition of orthographic changes.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

The change involves two words: "الابد" is replaced with "الدهر," which is a major word change since they have different roots, and "معه" is changed to "له," which is also a significant change in meaning and grammatical function. Therefore, since multiple words are altered, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

The change involves multiple words: "الابد" is replaced with "الدهر," "تكون" is changed to "يكون," and "معه" is replaced with "له." Since more than one word is altered, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves substituting the major word "الابد" with "الدهر," which alters the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it is a significant change in meaning due to the different root words.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves multiple words: "الابد" is replaced with "للدهر" and "معه" is replaced with "له". Since both changes affect different words, this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves the verb form from تكون to يكون, which is a modification in verb tense and form, affecting the grammatical function of the word but not its root. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it is a change to a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves two words: "يكون" is changed to "تكون," which is a significant change in verb form (from masculine singular to feminine singular), and "له" is changed to "معه," which alters the preposition and its pronominal suffix. Since both words are changed, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves the addition of the preposition ل before الدهر and a change in the verb form from يكون to تكون. The addition of the preposition is a minor change, and the change in the verb form is also considered minor since it does not alter the root of the word but rather changes the grammatical form. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it affects only minor words and does not involve a major word change.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves two words: the preposition "بل" is replaced with "لل", and the pronominal suffix "معه" is changed to "له". Since multiple words are altered in this transition, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves the addition of the major word نور (light) to the phrase, which alters the meaning significantly by introducing a new concept. The root of the word is different, as نور is a distinct noun that modifies الحياه, making it a major word change rather than a minor one.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The change involves the addition of the major word "الي," which introduces a new root word that significantly alters the meaning of the phrase. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it is not merely a minor word or particle but a significant addition that changes the context of the sentence.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

The change involves two distinct modifications: the omission of the word "اجاب" and the substitution of "يسوع" with "ايسوع". Since multiple words are altered in this transition, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The change involves the spelling of "يسوع" from "ايسوع," which is a variant spelling. This alteration does not affect the meaning of the word but rather standardizes its orthography. Similar to the examples provided, such as changing "يسوع" to "ايسوع," this fits the definition of an orthographic change.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

The change involves substituting the conjunction "وقال" with "فقال," which is a minor word change as it affects only a conjunction without altering the root of the word or the overall meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where the change is limited to a single minor word.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves two words: the verb "فقال" is replaced with "اجاب," which is a major word change since it alters the root of the verb, and the addition of the word "لهم" remains unchanged. Therefore, since there is a change across more than one word, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves the spelling of "يسوع" to "ايسوع," which is a variant spelling without affecting the meaning of the text. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, where the alteration does not change the root or grammatical function of the word. Similar examples include changes in spelling such as "يسوع" to "ايسوع."
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The change involves the omission of the conjunction و and the particle انما, resulting in a single minor word change where only the minor words are affected. The root of the word remains the same, and the overall meaning is not significantly altered. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves the alteration of minor words without changing the root.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

The phrase ⸂ايما تقضون⸃ is a significant unit of meaning, and its omission represents a major change in the text, as it removes a complete phrase that contributes to the overall meaning. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where the omission of a significant word or phrase alters the content of the text.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

The change involves the addition of the major word تقضوا, which is a verb form that significantly alters the meaning of the sentence. This is classified as a Single_Major_Word_Change because it introduces a new root word into the text, contrasting with the omitted text.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change involves the addition of the conjunction و at the beginning of the phrase, which qualifies as a minor word change since it does not alter the root of the word or the overall meaning significantly. The phrase remains a personal pronoun with a conjunction, fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The change involves the omission of the conjunction و and the addition of the conjunction ا, which alters the structure of the phrase but does not change the root or the major meaning of the words involved. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects only a minor word (the conjunction) and does not involve a major word change or multiple words.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase and the addition of an alif of nasb to احد, which are both considered minor changes. The root words remain the same, and the overall meaning is not significantly altered, fitting the criteria for a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word change since it does not alter the root or grammatical structure of the main content of the phrase. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Minor_Word_Change, where the addition of a conjunction is considered a minor alteration.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is a minor word. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it does not alter the root of the words or their grammatical function significantly. Similar examples include the addition of a conjunction or particle without affecting the meaning of the main content.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is a minor word change as it does not affect the root or grammatical function of the other words in the phrase. The rest of the phrase remains unchanged, fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the omission of the alif at the end of "احدا," which is an orthographic alteration that does not affect the meaning of the word. The root of the word remains the same, and it falls under the category of minor word changes as it pertains to a single minor word (the indefinite pronoun).
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the omission of the alif of nasb in the word أحدًا, which is a spelling alteration that does not affect the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a standardization of spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد
The change involves the substitution of the word ⸂لاني⸃ with two words ⸂هو لان⸃, which constitutes a change across more than one word. Therefore, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change involves the substitution of the verb لست with ليس, which is a minor word change as it affects the form of the verb but does not change the root of the word. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where modifications in verb form, such as changes in tense or voice, are included. The root remains the same, and only the form of the verb is altered.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change involves the verb form from ليست to ليس, which is a modification in verb tense or form but does not change the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change from ⸂ولكني⸃ to ⸂لكنى⸃ involves a variation in spelling without altering the meaning of the word. Both forms serve the same grammatical function as a conjunction, and the difference lies in the orthographic representation of the word. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, which include alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The major word حق is omitted, which constitutes a significant change as it alters the meaning of the phrase. The omission of a single major word falls under this category as it directly affects the content of the text.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The change involves the addition of the pronoun هي, which is a minor word that does not alter the root or the primary meaning of حق. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it is an addition to a single minor word without affecting the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change from ⸂انا⸃ to ⸂وانا⸃ involves the addition of the conjunction و to the pronoun, which qualifies as a minor word change. This aligns with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it pertains to the modification of a single minor word (in this case, a pronoun) without altering the root or the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The major word نفسى is omitted, which constitutes a significant change as it alters the meaning of the sentence. The omission of a major word like نفسى, which refers to "myself," impacts the overall message conveyed in the text. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where the root of the word is different or significant enough to affect the meaning.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change from ⸂على⸃ to ⸂لي⸃ involves a substitution of a preposition with a different root, which alters the meaning of the phrase significantly. Since the root of the word has changed, it qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

The change involves replacing the phrase ⸂على ذلك⸃ with ⸂لي وهو⸃, which consists of two distinct words. This alteration affects more than one word, thus falling under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change involves substituting the minor word ذلك with وهو. Both words serve as demonstrative pronouns, and the root of the word remains the same, thus fitting the criteria for a Single_Minor_Word_Change. The change does not affect the overall meaning significantly, as it still refers to a similar concept.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change from ⸂يسوع⸃ to ⸂ايسوع⸃ involves a variation in spelling without altering the meaning of the word. This fits the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a variant spelling of the same name. Similar examples include changes in spelling that do not affect the semantic content of the text.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

The change involves substituting the conjunction ف with و in the phrase, which is a minor alteration affecting only a single word (the conjunction). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it does not affect the root of the word or the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change involves the omission of the auxiliary verb "كان" and the transformation of "يكلمهم" to "كلمهم," which alters the root of the verb from a continuous aspect to a simple past aspect. This constitutes a significant change in meaning and grammatical function, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.

The change involves the spelling of the word "ساعته" to "ساعه," which is a variation in orthography without affecting the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it pertains to how the word is written rather than altering its grammatical function or meaning.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change involves the spelling of "ساعته" to "الساعه," which is a variant spelling that does not affect the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it involves standardizing the spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم
The change involves two words: "لان" is replaced with "اذ" and "ساعه" is replaced with "كانت". Since both words are altered, this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

The change involves substituting the entire phrase "تكن بلغت" with "تكون اقتربت," which alters the root of the verbs from "تكن" (to be) and "بلغت" (to reach) to "تكون" (to become) and "اقتربت" (to approach). This constitutes a significant change in meaning and grammatical function, as it replaces both words with different roots. Therefore, it fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change involves the verb "تكون" being altered to "تكن," which is a modification in verb form but does not change the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (a verb in this case) without altering its root. The change is significant in terms of verb form but remains within the same root.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The change involves substituting the verb "اقتربت" with "اتت," which alters the root of the word, indicating a significant change in meaning and grammatical function. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as the root of the verb is different between the two readings.

The change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is replaced with "انطلق," "وتطلبوني" is changed to "وتطلبونى," and "وفي" is replaced with "ولا." Since more than one word is altered in this transition, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The change involves the omission of the conjunction و, which is classified as a minor word. The root of the word خطاياكم remains unchanged, and the overall meaning is still preserved despite the removal of the conjunction. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it only affects a single minor word.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

The change involves multiple words: "خطاياكم" is replaced by "تجدونى وباثمكم," which consists of two distinct words. This falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes as it includes both the addition of "تجدونى" and "باثمكم," indicating a significant alteration across more than one word.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change involves the alteration of the verb form from تموتون to تموتوا, which is a modification in the verb tense or form but does not change the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering its root.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The change involves substituting the verb "انطلق" with "اذهب," which are different roots and thus constitutes a major word change. The root of "انطلق" (to set out) is different from that of "اذهب" (to go), fitting the criteria for a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

The change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is replaced with "انطلق," and "فانتم" is added, which constitutes a significant alteration across more than one word. This fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it includes both a major word change and the addition of another word.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

The change involves two words: the negation "ليس" is replaced with "لا," and the verb "تاتون" is changed to "تجون." Since both changes affect different words, this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

The change involves the verb form from تقدرو to تقدرون, which is a modification in the verb tense and number (from second person plural to first person plural). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word. The root remains the same, and the change does not involve multiple words.
c.f. ليس تقدرو تاتوا ➞ ليس تقدرون تاتوا

The change involves multiple words: "ليس" is replaced with "لا," "تاتوا" is replaced with "تجون," and the verb form is altered. Since there are changes across more than one word, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتوا ➞ لا تقدرون تجون
The form of the verb قالوا is changed to قال

The change involves the addition of the interrogative particle 'ما', which is classified as a minor word. This addition does not alter the root of any major word and fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it pertains to a single minor word being added.
c.f. OMIT ➞ ما
The minor word ان is added.
The form of تاتوا is changed to تاتون.
The pronoun انتم is omitted.
The pronoun انتم is changed to ان and the form of the verb تاتون is changed to تاتوا. Both are minor changes but taken together, they are a changes to multiple words.

The change involves the omission of the pronoun انتم, which is a minor word, while the root of the verb تاتون remains unchanged. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it only affects a single minor word without altering the root or the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. انتم تاتون ➞ ان تاتون

The change involves substituting the verb تاتون with تحون, which alters the root of the word from ت-ا-ت-ي (to come) to ح-و-ا (to be). This constitutes a significant change in meaning and grammatical function, as it changes the action being described. Therefore, it fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. انتم تاتون ➞ انتم تحون

The change involves modifying the verb form from تاتوا (you [plural] come) to تاتون (you [plural] are coming), which is a change in the verb tense and form but does not alter the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without changing its root.
c.f. ان تاتوا ➞ تاتون

This constitutes a significant change in meaning, as it shifts from a specific reference to a particular devil to a more general term. Therefore, it falls under the category of Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ ➞ اما شيطان فليس
The major word شيطان is added.
The major word التمس is omitted.

The change from ⸂التمس⸃ to ⸂اطلب⸃ involves substituting one word for another with a different root. The word "التمس" (to seek) is replaced by "اطلب" (to request), which alters the meaning significantly as they are not different forms of the same root but rather distinct verbs. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where the root of the word is different.
c.f. التمس ➞ اطلب

The major word "اطلب" is omitted, which constitutes a significant change as it alters the meaning of the sentence. The omission of a single major word falls under this category, as it affects the overall message conveyed in the text.
c.f. اطلب ➞ OMIT
The preposition هو was added.

The change involves substituting the phrase ⸂هو الذي⸃ with ⸂الذى⸃, which alters the root of the word from a pronoun and relative pronoun combination to a single relative pronoun. This constitutes a significant change in meaning and grammatical function, as it removes the pronoun "هو" and modifies the structure of the phrase. Therefore, it fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى
The change involves two words: "هو" is replaced with "الذي" and "الذي" is replaced with "هو". Since both words are altered, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو

The word ⸂ان⸃ is a conjunction that can be omitted without changing the overall meaning of the sentence. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes the omission of minor words such as conjunctions. The change does not affect the root of any major words or the grammatical structure significantly.
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

The change involves substituting the word "الابد" with "الدهر," which are different root words. This alteration significantly affects the meaning of the phrase, as "الابد" refers to eternity while "الدهر" refers to a long period of time or an era. Therefore, it qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
